snippet.title: 'Our police will be the best in the country'
snippet.content:
BREAKING: Premier Mark McGowan has announced WA Police's new Commissioner will be Chris Dawson. Mr Dawson has been chief executive of the Australian Crime Commission since 2014 (renamed Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission in 2016) and before that was deputy to Police Commissioner Karl O'Callaghan at WA Police. Mr McGowan, who announced the appointment at a press conference with Police Minister Michelle Roberts this morning, described Mr Dawson as "an accomplished police officer". "One of the most accomplished police officers in the entirety of the country," the Premier said. "I believe he has the drive, the determination to make sure our police our the best in the country."
. says Chris Dawson has been at the forefront of the fight against meth at the Aust Criminal Intelligence Commission.
He was awarded the Australian policing medal for distinguished service in the 2002 Queens Birthday Honours list. Mr O'Callaghan is scheduled to retire in two weeks after more than 13 years in the top job.
